definition: to provoke/to irritate/to upset/to stimulate/to excite/irritant
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

pinyin: fei4 ci4 ji1 xing4 du2 ji4

sentences.english: The nature of the stimulus may predispose some children to attention problems.
sentences.chinese: 刺激本身很可能使一些孩子易产生注意力问题。

sentences.english: It was nerve-wracking somehow this year. But I still came through.
sentences.chinese: 今年很多时候有些紧张刺激，但我都挺过来了。

sentences.english: Hitchcock also got a perverse thrill out of taking audiences on a voyeuristic roller-coaster ride.
sentences.chinese: 希区柯克也有有害刺激的考虑受众的偷窥过山车旅程。

sentences.english: Modify your diet to exclude or limit dairy products, alcohol, smoking or other stimulants.
sentences.chinese: 不吃或少吃乳制品，尽量不要接近烟酒或其他刺激物。

sentences.english: After light stimulation, negative waves were recorded from each electrode.
sentences.chinese: 经光刺激后，负波被每个电极记录下来。

sentences.english: Pressor response was induced by electrical stimulation of the hypothalamic defence area.
sentences.chinese: 电刺激下丘脑“防御反应区”诱发升压反应。

sentences.english: Lleras based his theory on the idea that our senses become used to stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 雷若斯的理论是以我们感官会习惯的外来刺激为根据。

sentences.english: Glacial acetic acid is a dehydrating agent and an irritant and is corrosive.
sentences.chinese: 冰醋酸是个脱水代理及刺激物和腐蚀。

sentences.english: Zhao Zigeng smiled, and did not care to verbal stimuli "."
sentences.chinese: 赵子庚笑笑，毫不在意并以言语刺激宇文。

sentences.english: Dirt, bacteria, and makeup left on overnight can irritate skin, clog pores, and trigger breakouts.
sentences.chinese: 超过一夜的灰尘，细菌和化妆刺激皮肤，堵塞毛孔。

sentences.english: The creature is unable to see well because of overstimulation of the eyes.
sentences.chinese: 生物因为双眼的刺激而无法清楚视物。

sentences.english: It has saved my post-shave legs from irritation and allowed me to wear shorts all summer long.
sentences.chinese: 它救了我的后刮胡子腿从刺激和允许我穿短裤夏天长。

sentences.english: The locks prevent its downward and upward movement at the same time stimulating energy.
sentences.chinese: 收束在阻塞了能量上下运动的同时，也刺激着能量。

sentences.english: Those are all the--his conditioned stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 身边都是他的条件刺激。

sentences.english: There are several relaxation mechanism according to different stimulated condition.
sentences.chinese: 随刺激条件不同而有多种弛豫机构。

sentences.english: Beral thinks a more interesting candidate for study is prolactin .
sentences.chinese: 贝拉尔认为，一个更为有趣的研究课题是泌乳刺激素。

definition: to induce/to promote/to urge/to impel/to bring about/to provoke/to drive (sb to do sth)/to catalyze/to actuate/to contribute to (some development)
to make heavier/to emphasize/(of an illness etc) to become more serious/to aggravate (a bad situation)/to increase (a burden, punishment etc)
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to promote (an idea or cause)/to advance/boost
